property.name: mediadisplayblurb
property.value: Women at an Afghan border crossing

note.text: The border between Afghanistan and Pakistan has always been somewhat porous, in part because Pashtuns live on both sides. During the Afghan War of the 1980s, millions of Afghans fled to Pakistan. There are still approximately 3 million Afghan refugees in the country.

Pakistanis have also emigrated in search of work. There are large Pakistani populations in the Gulf states, the U.S., the UK, and other English-speaking countries. More than 5 million Pakistanis currently live outside Pakistan.
